meta.description: One unit of fruit salad A requires 1/4 of a mango, 1/8 of a pineapple, and 3 strawberries, with a net profit of 10 RMB. Making one unit of fruit salad B requires 1/2 a mango, 1/4 of a pineapple, and 1 strawberry, with a net profit of 20 RMB. The stock/resources row shows that there are 25 mangos, 10 pineapples, and 120 strawberries available for making these fruit salads. Suppose all fruits need to be processed and completely used to make the fruit salads A and B. All fruits must satisfy the constraint of having at most 5 units left or 5 additional units used. Find the maximal total profits of the fruit store. Note: Since we want to produce “complete fruit salads”, the variables x1 and x2 should actually be modeled as integer variables: x1, x2 ∈ Z.

params.name: profit
params.description: Profit per unit of fruit salad

params.name: requirement
params.description: Fruit requirements per unit of fruit salad

vars.name: x
vars.description: Number of units of each fruit salad to produce

objective.name: total_profit
objective.expr: quicksum(profit[s] * x[s] for s in S)
objective.description: Maximize total profit from fruit salads

constraints.name: mango_usage
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(requirement[s]['mango'] * x[s] for s in S)

constraints.name: pineapple_usage
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(requirement[s]['pineapple'] * x[s] for s in S)

constraints.name: strawberry_usage
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(requirement[s]['strawberry'] * x[s] for s in S)
